Android Application
Project Overview
Fascinated by the world of smartphone and apps, I finally decided to make my own Android Application during my semester holidays after third semester. At first app devolopement was totally new to me, so it took me sometime to grasp and link all the dots.
I downloaded the Android Studio IDE and started building the application. Before making the final app, I made two- three test application to understand the concept of ACTIVITY, MANIFEST, LAYOUT etc in details. For testing purposes I mostly used USB Debuging than Android AVD manager. The main functionality of the application deveploped is to apply various filters on images. After building it, the major work was to publish it on Google Play Store. Now you can install the application on your mobile from Google Play Store using the link provided on previous page.
Go Back
Place - Hometown
Time of Work
It took me approximately a month to deveplop the application. The application went live on Play Store on 21 March 2021.
The main time consuming process was to make it more user friendly. It was tested extensively on various mobile phones including 8 year old phones before launching.
Go Back
Major Challenge: Make it available for even older Android APIs
Resources Used and Skills Learnt
I usually took help of the Google Android Documentation, but GeeksforGeek, TutorialsPoint, Stack Overflow was also very helpful to me in developing the application.
I also used some libraries to add some features on the app. API was a major challenge, that is to make it available on most of the devices. I dedided to built it for devices with OS JellyBean or above.
